title: Roberto Ascari
about
text: Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished document. To learn more about Quarto see https://quarto.org.

title: about
text:
Running Code
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

1 + 1

[1] 2


You can add options to executable code like this


[1] 4


The echo: false option disables the printing of code (only output is displayed).

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
About me
I am an Assistant Professor in Statistics at the Department of Economics, Management and Statistics (DEMS) at University of Milano-Bicocca.
Research interests: Compositional data analysis; Bayesian inference; Mixture models; Computational Statistics; Regression models for bounded responses; Latent topic models.
E-mail: roberto.ascari@unimib.it

Projects

Scientific Degrees Plan: presenting statistics to high schools (from 2018 to 2024)

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
I am interested on Bayesian Analysis, especially on Bayesian Nonparametric models. My research is based on exploring innovative approaches in model-based clustering. I am currently working on:

Bayesian clustering methods with high dimensional data;
Multivariate time series with changepoint detection.
Topic modelling techniques with distributions defined on the simplex.

title: Roberto Ascari

title: Alice Giampino
Alice Giampino
text:
PhD courses projects

Gradient - R package: R package to calculate the gradient of a function.
Post selection inference fMRI Data: visualization of active area in a brain during an experiment.
Forest Fire Bayesian Analysis: an analysis of the burnt area for forest fires in Portugal.

title: Alice Giampino
text:
Education
 - Ph.D. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2019--2023. 
Thesis title: [*Innovative approaches to Bayesian Clustering Methods: parametric and nonparametric perspectives*](files/PhD_thesis_Alice_Giampino.pdf).  
I worked under the joint supervision of  prof. [Bernardo Niporti](https://www.bernardonipoti.com/) and prof. [Michele Guindani](https://www.micheleguindani.info/). 

M.Sc. in Statistical Sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.
Period 2017 - 2019. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Functional telecommunication data: a Bayesian nonparametric approach.

Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.

B.Sc. in Statistical sciences, University of Milano-Bicocca, Milan, Italy.

Period 2014–2017. Final mark: 110/110 with laude.
Thesis title: Box-Cox transformation: an analysis based on the likelihood.
Advisor: Sonia Migliorati.

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
Education

Ph.D. in Statistics and Mathematics for Finance, University of Milano-Bicocca. Period: 2015 - 2018. Thesis: A family of flexible mixture distributions for constrained data. Advisor: Prof. Andrea Ongaro.
M.Sc. in Biostatistics, University of Milano-Bicocca. Period: 2013 - 2015. Final mark: 110/110 with honors. Thesis: MCMC Bayesian estimation for a particular mixture model on the simplex. Advisor: Prof. Sonia Migliorati.
B.Sc. in Statistics and Information Management, University of Milano-Bicocca. Period: 2019 - 2013. Final mark: 107/110. Thesis: Mortality and respiratory tract infections in a population of 7000 patients undergoing cardiac surgery. Advisor: Prof. Vincenzo Bagnardi.

title: Alice Giampino

Outlier detection with different models(R language);

Ames House Price prediction(R code)

title: Roberto Ascari
text:
Accepted - Colicino, E., Ascari, R., Saddiki, H. et al. Cross-cohort mixture analysis: a data integration approach with applications on gestational age and DNA-methylation-derived gestational age acceleration metrics. Biometrical Journal, 10.1002/bimj.202300270.
Accepted - Gerli, S., Ascari, R., Migliorati, S., Cigna, T., Borrotti, M. Beyond human labelling: an automatic topic identification framework for big web data. Electronic Journal of Applied Statistical Analysis.
2024 - Ongaro, A., Migliorati, S., Ascari, R., Ripamonti, E. Testing practical relevance of treatment effects. Statistical Papers, 65, 4121-–4145, 10.1007/s00362-024-01549-x.
2024 - Ascari, R., Giabelli, A., Malandri, L., Mercorio, F., Mezzanzanica, M. A Fistful of Vectors: A Tool for Intrinsic Evaluation of Word Embeddings. Cognitive Computation, 16, 949–-963, 10.1007/s12559-023-10235-3.
2024 - Ascari, R., Di Brisco, A.M., Migliorati, S., Ongaro, A. A Multivariate Mixture Regression Model for Constrained Responses. Bayesian Analysis, 19(2), 377–405, 10.1214/22-BA1359.

2021 - Oliveira dos Anjos, T.B., [et al., including Ascari, R.]. Eutrophic status influences the impact of pesticide mixtures and predation on Daphnia pulex populations. Ecology and Evolution}*. 11(9), 4046-4057, 10.1002/ece3.7305.
2021 - Sorrentino, S., Ascari, R., et al. (2021). Microglial heterogeneity and its potential role in driving phenotypic diversity of alzheimer’s disease. International Journal of Molecular Sciences, 22(5), 2780, 10.3390/ijms22052780.
